item.title: Declaring
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

setSkillLevel(3, 99999999, c.playerLevel[3]);

Why do you have your skill level declared twice?

setSkillLevel(skill id, skill level, skill xp);

Read full topic

item.title: Declaring
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Here’s what I have for my setSkillLevel.

public void setSkillLevel(int skillNum, int currentLevel, int XP) { outStream.createFrame(134); outStream.writeByte(skillNum); outStream.writeDWord_v1(XP); outStream.writeByte(currentLevel); }

Read full topic

item.title: Declaring
item.dc:creator: @funyou funyou
item.description:
@funyou wrote:

I’ve learned a lot from the forums here on moparisthebest.com… But I never learned how to declare something or where to do it… Could anyone help? I need to declare “setSkillLevel(int,int,int)” Somewhere…

I’m trying to do so for this code:
}
else if (playerCommand.startsWith(“invinsible”) && c.playerRights >= 3) {

			c.sendMessage("You.. are.. INVINSIBLE");
    			c.playerLevel[3] = 99999999;
    			c.setSkillLevel(3, 99999999, c.playerLevel[3]);
    		}

This is the compiler error:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:202: cannot find symbol
symbol : method setSkillLevel(int,int,int)
location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands
setSkillLevel(3, 99999999, c.playerLevel[3]);
^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

Could anyone help plz? Thanks :o

Read full topic
